actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3425.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barrett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3425 — "To direct the Director of the Federal Protective Service to establish processes to strengthen oversight, performance, and accountability of contract security personnel engaged in the protection of certain buildings and grounds, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3424.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barrett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3424 — "To require the Administrator of the General Services Administration to collaborate with Federal tenants with respect to shared-space arrangements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3423.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barrett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3423 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to include aircraft deicing storage facilities in the definition of airport development, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3055.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barrett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3055 — "To direct the Secretary of Transportation to develop an action plan on members of the Armed Forces eligible for preseparation counseling and veterans becoming supply chain employees, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2591.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Barrett moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2591 — "To require the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to revise regulations for certain individuals carrying out aviation activities who disclose a mental health diagnosis or condition, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4550.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Thompson (PA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 4550 — "To reauthorize the United States Grain Standards Act, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 8.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Young Kim to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
